item.title: 'J&K incomplete without PoK': Rajnath Singh lashes out at 'PoK PM' over anti-India remarks - Moneycontrol
item.description:
'J&K incomplete without PoK': Rajnath Singh lashes out at 'PoK PM' over anti-India remarks

Date: January 14, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

Defence Minister Rajnath Singh criticized Pakistan's efforts to destabilize Jammu and Kashmir, asserting that the region is incomplete without Pakistan-occupied Kashmir (PoK). He condemned remarks made by PoK PM Chaudhry Anwarul Haq, who has called for jihad against India.

  • Rajnath Singh stated that Pakistan is attempting to destabilize Jammu and Kashmir.
  • He emphasized the connection between the people of J&K and Delhi.
  • Singh accused Pakistan of using PoK as a base for terrorism.
  • He inaugurated a 108-foot national flag and a heritage museum in Jammu.
“Pakistan making all efforts to destabilise Jammu and Kashmir. Efforts underway to reduce distance between hearts of people of J&K and Delhi,” - Rajnath Singh

This statement comes amid rising tensions and ongoing discussions about the future of Jammu and Kashmir.

item.title: Mahakumbh 2025 Live: Sea of people descend at Triveni Sangam on Makar Sankranti - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Mahakumbh 2025 Live: Sea of people descend at Triveni Sangam on Makar Sankranti

Publication Date: January 14, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Mahakumbh 2025 is a grand 45-day event taking place in Prayagraj, Uttar Pradesh, which began on January 14 and will conclude on February 26, expecting participation from around 45 crore people.

  • Over one crore devotees have participated on the first day for the holy dip on Makar Sankranti.
  • The Uttar Pradesh government is using modern technology for crowd management and safety.
  • Significant dates during the Mahakumbh include January 29, February 3 and 26.
  • The event promotes the message of unity and “Vasudhaiva Kutumbakam” (the world is one family).
“I have been attending the Kumbh Mela since 1982... This time the experience is very different. A new city has been set up...” - BJP leader Sadhvi Niranjan Jyoti.

The Mahakumbh Mela not only showcases the cultural heritage of India but also attracts global participants, showcasing the essence of unity and spirituality.

item.title: 2 TMC workers injured in shootout in West Bengal's Malda - The Times of India
item.description:
Two TMC Workers Injured in Malda Shootout

Date: [Publication Date] Source: [Source Name]

In a violent incident in Malda, West Bengal, two workers of the Trinamool Congress (TMC) were injured during a shootout.

  • The shootout happened in an area where political tensions have been rising.
  • Both victims were taken to a nearby hospital for treatment.
  • Authorities are investigating the incident and searching for suspects.
"We are looking into the matter seriously and will ensure that those responsible are brought to justice." - Local Law Enforcement

This incident raises concerns over the increasing political violence in the region, prompting the need for enhanced security measures.

item.title: Arvind Kejriwal's big claim ahead of Delhi election: ‘BJP distributing gold chains for votes’ - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Kejriwal Accuses BJP of Distributing Gold Chains for Votes Ahead of Delhi Elections

Date: January 14, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

In a press conference, Arvind Kejriwal, the AAP leader, accused the BJP of attempting to buy votes by distributing gold chains in two Delhi colonies as the election approaches.

  • Kejriwal alleges BJP has started distributing gold chains in exchange for votes.
  • He urges voters not to sell their votes and to reject any candidates who distribute money or goods.
  • BJP responds by accusing Kejriwal of failing to keep his promises and embracing corruption.
“We are not here to win or lose elections; we are here to change the country.” - Arvind Kejriwal

Kejriwal's comments highlight concerns over electoral integrity as the Delhi assembly elections approach.

item.title: BRS leaders K T Rama Rao, Harish Rao placed under ‘house arrest’ - The Indian Express
item.description:
Top BRS leaders including KT Rama Rao placed under ‘house arrest’

Date: January 14, 2025 Source: Indian Express

Several top leaders of the Bharat Rashtra Samithi (BRS), including working president K T Rama Rao and T Harish Rao, were allegedly placed under house arrest in Telangana on Tuesday. This follows the arrest of BRS legislator Padi Kaushik Reddy, which caused political tensions in the region.

  • KTR and Harish Rao placed under house arrest in Hyderabad and Kokapet respectively.
  • The arrests come after a clash involving BRS legislator Padi Kaushik Reddy.
  • Kaushik Reddy was granted bail after being arrested following an altercation with another MLA.
KTR stated, “Illegal cases and arresting BRS leaders have become commonplace under Congress Chief Minister Revanth Reddy’s government.”

The situation highlights ongoing political tensions and accusations of political vendetta within Telangana's ruling structures.

item.title: 'IIT baba' at Maha Kumbh: Meet Abhay Singh who turned to spirituality after studying aerospace engineering - Moneycontrol
item.description:
Meet Abhay Singh, the IITian Baba Embracing Spirituality at Maha Kumbh

Date: January 14, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

The Maha Kumbh Mela has begun in Prayagraj, attracting millions of devotees. This year's event is notable for its spiritual significance and a rare celestial occurrence. Abhay Singh, also known as IITian Baba, has found his calling in spirituality after studying at IIT Bombay and completing his master's in design.

  • Over 40 crore pilgrims expected to attend the 45-day Maha Kumbh.
  • Event coincides with a rare celestial occurrence not seen in 144 years.
  • A diverse assembly of spiritual figures, including Naga Sadhus, is participating.
  • This is the first Maha Kumbh heavily featured on social media.
  • Abhay Singh's story is among those gaining attention at the Mela.
"This year's event holds unparalleled spiritual significance."

The attendance at the Maha Kumbh showcases a blend of tradition and modernity as spirituality meets the influence of social media.

item.title: Video | World's Largest Gathering Of Humanity From The Skies - NDTV
item.description:
Maha Kumbh Mela 2025: The World's Largest Religious Gathering

Publication Date: Not specified   Source: Not specified

Experience breathtaking drone visuals of Maha Kumbh Mela 2025, the largest religious gathering on Earth, showcasing the spiritual grandeur and devotion of millions in celebration.

  • The Maha Kumbh Mela is known as the largest religious congregation globally.
  • Drone visuals highlight the scale and beauty of this event.
  • Millions of participants come together to celebrate spiritual devotion.

item.title: ‘Over 3000 special trains, 554 ticketing counters, 1176 CCTV cameras’- Indian Railways plan to cater the Mahakumbh - The Indian Express
item.description:
‘Over 3000 special trains, 554 ticketing counters, 1176 CCTV cameras’- Indian Railways plan to cater the Mahakumbh

Date: January 14, 2025 Source: Indian Express

Indian Railways has prepared an extensive plan to accommodate the expected influx of pilgrims for the Maha Kumbh 2025, which is projected to attract around 40 crore visitors.

  • Over 3,000 special trains will be operational, significantly increasing capacity compared to the 2019 Ardh Kumbh.
  • A total of 554 ticketing counters, including mobile Unreserved Ticketing System (UTS) counters, have been set up.
  • 1176 CCTV cameras have been installed at key stations for real-time monitoring of passenger safety.
  • 12-language announcement systems will assist diverse pilgrims at major stations.
  • Infrastructure investments totaling Rs. 3700 crore have facilitated vital projects to enhance accessibility.
“An investment of Rs. 5,000 crore has been made over the past three years for Kumbh-related projects.”

The preparations reflect the Indian Railways' commitment to provide safe and efficient services for the Mahakumbh, addressing the needs of millions of attendees.

item.title: Dr. V. Narayanan Assumed Charge of Secretary, Department of Space and Chairman, Space Commission - ISRO
item.description:
Dr. V. Narayanan Assumed Charge of Secretary, Department of Space and Chairman, Space Commission

Date: January 13, 2025

Source: Official ISRO Release

On January 13, 2025, Dr. V. Narayanan took over as Secretary of the Department of Space and Chairman of the Space Commission, previously serving as Director of the Liquid Propulsion Systems Centre (LPSC).

  • Dr. Narayanan led LPSC, focusing on the development of advanced propulsion systems.
  • Under his leadership, India developed self-reliance in Cryogenic Propulsion Systems.
  • He contributed significantly to the Gaganyaan human spaceflight project.
  • Dr. Narayanan has received numerous awards for his contributions to space science.
“The development of Cryogenic Propulsion Systems made India one among six countries to have this capability.”

In conclusion, Dr. Narayanan's extensive background and leadership in ISRO are expected to further advance India's space exploration efforts.

item.title: Delhi Police to probe Arvind Kejriwal's allegations against BJP's Parvesh Verma: Election official - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Delhi Police to Investigate Kejriwal's Claims Against BJP's Parvesh Verma

Date: January 14, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

The New Delhi district election officer has passed complaints from the Aam Aadmi Party against BJP candidate Parvesh Verma for alleged violations of the electoral moral code, forwarding them to the police for investigation.

  • Kejriwal accuses Verma of cash distribution and organizing job camps illegally.
  • The police are investigating the allegations under the Representation of Peoples Act.
  • No evidence of the alleged job camps has been found by election officials.
  • Kejriwal alleges collusion between local election officers and BJP, as well as voter deletions from rolls.
“These things come under corrupt practices under the rules and regulations of the Election Commission...” - Arvind Kejriwal

This investigation underscores ongoing tensions in the Delhi election landscape, highlighting serious allegations regarding electoral integrity.

item.title: ‘Over 3000 special trains, 554 ticketing counter, 1176 CCTV cameras’- Indian Railways plan to cater the Mahakumbh - The Indian Express
item.description:
‘Over 3000 special trains, 554 ticketing counter, 1176 CCTV cameras’- Indian Railways plan to cater the Mahakumbh

Date: January 14, 2025 | Source: Indian Express

Indian Railways is implementing extensive arrangements for Maha Kumbh 2025, including over 3,000 special trains and numerous safety measures aimed at catering to millions of pilgrims expected to attend.

  • Over 3,000 special trains will operate, significantly more than in previous years.
  • 554 ticketing counters, including mobile Unreserved Ticketing System (UTS) counters.
  • 1176 CCTV cameras installed for real-time monitoring across stations.
  • 12 language announcement systems established to assist pilgrims.
  • Investment of Rs. 5,000 crore in infrastructure for the Kumbh.
  • 40 crore pilgrims expected, with 5 crore on Mauni Amavasya alone.
“Freight trains have been diverted to Dedicated Freight Corridors (DFC) to ensure smooth passenger train operations.”

With improved facilities and infrastructure, Indian Railways aims to enhance the experience of the pilgrims during this significant event.

item.title: 1,100 Bulls, Truck, Car On Prize List: Jallikattu Event Begins In Tamil Nadu - NDTV
item.description:
1,100 Bulls, Truck, Car On Prize List: Jallikattu Event Begins In Tamil Nadu

Publication Date: January 15, 2025 | Source: NDTV

The renowned Jallikattu event has commenced in Madurai, Tamil Nadu, featuring 1,100 bulls and strict regulations to ensure safety and organization.

  • Event held in Avaniyapuram village with a total of 1,100 bulls and 900 bull tamers.
  • Prizes include a tractor worth Rs 11 lakhs for the best bull and a car worth Rs 8 lakhs for the best bull-tamer.
  • Subsequent events will occur on January 15 and 16 at Palamedu and Alanganallur.
  • Each bull can participate in only one event, accompanied by the owner and a trainer.
  • Registration required via the official district website, documents verified for eligibility.
“Jallikattu is an age-old bull-taming event celebrated mostly in Tamil Nadu as part of Pongal celebrations.”

This year’s events promise to attract local and international attention while celebrating Tamil heritage.

item.title: Karnataka: Minister Hebbalkar, MLC Hattiholi injured in road accident - Deccan Herald
item.description:
Karnataka Minister Laxmi Hebbalkar Injured in Road Accident

Published on: 14 January 2025, 03:44 IST

Source: Deccan Herald

Women and Child Welfare Minister Laxmi Hebbalkar and her brother MLC Channaraj Hattiholi were injured in a road accident near Belagavi when their SUV lost control and crashed into a tree.

  • The accident occurred on the Pune-Bengaluru national highway.
  • Hebbalkar suffered back injuries while Hattiholi sustained head and ear injuries.
  • They were rushed to Vijaya Ortho and Trauma Centre for treatment.
  • The accident happened while avoiding stray dogs on the road.
  • Authorities have registered a case regarding the incident.
“Laxmi and Channaraj were coming by road when the accident took place.” — Mrinal Hebbalkar

Dr. Ravi Patil mentioned that Hebbalkar will require a minimum of one month's rest following the accident.

Notable figures, including Chief Minister Siddaramaiah, have inquired about their health.

item.title: Happy Makar Sankranti 2025: Wishes, images, quotes, WhatsApp status, messages, photos and greetings - The Indian Express
item.description:
Happy Makar Sankranti 2025: Wishes, Images, Quotes, WhatsApp Status, Messages, and Photos

Date: January 14, 2025 | Source: indianexpress.com

Makar Sankranti, celebrated across India, marks the transition of the sun into Capricorn and is associated with the harvest season. The festival involves kite flying, bonfires, and spiritual practices aimed at purification and good karma.

  • Celebration date: January 14, 2025.
  • Auspicious timing from 09:03 AM to 05:46 PM.
  • Festivities include kite flying and sharing of sweets.
“Wishing you a prosperous and joyous Makar Sankranti! May your life soar as high as the kites in the sky.”

Join the celebration with warm wishes, quotes, and visuals shared online!

item.title: Happy Pongal 2025: Wishes, Images, WhatsApp status, Messages, Quotes and greetings, cards to share this Pongal - The Indian Express
item.description:
Happy Pongal 2025: Wishes, Images, WhatsApp Status, Messages, Quotes, and Greetings to Share

Date: January 14, 2025 | Source: Indian Express

Pongal is an auspicious Hindu festival celebrated mostly in India’s southern states, particularly in Tamil Nadu. The four-day harvest festival honors the Sun God, starting on January 14, 2025, and concludes on January 17.

  • Traditionally celebrated with music, dance, and the preparation of sweet rice dish called Pongal.
  • The festival emphasizes community, gratitude, and joy among families and friends.
  • Curated lists of wishes, greetings, and cards are available for sharing on WhatsApp and Facebook.
“May the blessings of Surya Dev bring light and warmth into your life. Happy Pongal!”

This Pongal is not just a celebration of the harvest but a time to reflect on the positivity and sweetness that life can offer. Happy Pongal!

item.title: IITian Baba at Mahakumbh: He studied aerospace engineering at IIT Bombay, then turned to spirituality - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Meet Abhay Singh, the IITian Baba who quit science for spirituality

Date: Jan 14, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

At the world’s largest religious festival, the Mahakumbh Mela in Prayagraj, Uttar Pradesh, millions of devotees gather. This year, an IITian Baba, Abhay Singh, is making headlines for choosing spirituality over his engineering career.

  • Abhay Singh studied aerospace engineering at IIT Bombay.
  • He also pursued a Masters in Design after his engineering studies.
  • Singh was born in Haryana and has incorporated philosophy into his life pursuits.
  • His conversation with an interviewer has gone viral online.
  • Singh believes that pursuing knowledge leads to spiritual fulfillment.
“If you keep pursuing knowledge, where do you reach? This is where you reach.”

The Maha Kumbh started on January 13 and continues until February 26, attracting participants from various backgrounds.

item.title: Happy Pongal 2025: Best wishes, greetings, cards, WhatsApp status, SMS, images to share this Pongal - The Indian Express
item.description:
Happy Pongal 2025: Wishes, Images, WhatsApp Status, Messages, Quotes and Greetings

Date: January 14, 2025 | Source: Indian Express

Pongal is a significant Hindu festival celebrated mainly in Tamil Nadu, marking the gratitude for agricultural prosperity. It lasts for four days, beginning on January 14, 2025.

  • Pongal, a harvest festival, honors the Sun God.
  • Traditional dishes, including sweet rice (Pongal), are prepared to celebrate.
  • The festival encourages community bonding and gratitude.
  • Various wishes and messages can be shared across social media.
“May your year be as sweet as the sugarcane on Pongal!”

In summary, Pongal 2025 is an occasion for celebration, joy, and community spirit, emphasizing love and gratitude.

item.title: Indian killed while fighting on Russia-Ukraine war frontlines, had been making desperate pleas to be brought back home - The Indian Express
item.description:
Indian Soldier Killed in Russia-Ukraine Conflict Amid Desperate Pleas for Return

Date: January 13, 2025 Source: The Indian Express

A 32-year-old youth from Kerala, Binil T B, has been killed while fighting on the frontlines for the Russian Army in the ongoing conflict with Ukraine.

  • Binil had traveled to Russia in April for employment opportunities and was later conscripted into the army.
  • His relative, Jain T K, was also injured in the same attack.
  • Binil's family was informed through the Indian Embassy in Moscow about his death.
  • Binil had made desperate calls for help and expressed the need to return home.
  • He previously stated they had been unsuccessfully trying to contact the Indian embassy since September.
  • This is the second reported death of a Keralite in the Russian army fighting against Ukraine.
“Mentally and physically, we are exhausted,” Binil said in his last message.

The tragic incident highlights the risks faced by Indian laborers who were lured into military service under the pretense of job opportunities.

item.title: Army General Upendra Dwivedi calls out Pakistan over terrorism, says no troop cuts at LAC - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Army General Upendra Dwivedi calls out Pakistan over terrorism, says no troop cuts at LAC

Publication Date: Jan 14, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

In a recent press conference, Indian Army chief General Upendra Dwivedi labeled Pakistan as the “epicentre” of terrorism, adding that a significant percentage of active militants in Jammu and Kashmir are of Pakistani origin. He emphasized that troop levels along the Line of Actual Control (LAC) will not be reduced this winter.

  • Gen Dwivedi stated that 80% of terrorists in Jammu and Kashmir are from Pakistan.
  • The Army has received emergency procurement powers for counter-terror operations amidst increasing infiltration attempts from Pakistan.
  • There has been a rise in terrorist activities particularly in North Kashmir and the Doda-Kishtwar region.
  • Despite the escalation in attacks, the 2021 ceasefire agreement with Pakistan remains intact.
  • The situation with China at the LAC is described as sensitive but stable, with no troop cuts planned.
  • Trust-building measures are ongoing, and troop deployment reviews can happen before summer.
“In recent months, increased terrorist activities were seen in North Kashmir. Last year, 60% of the terrorists eliminated were of Pakistan origin.” - General Upendra Dwivedi

The emphasis on a balanced military deployment along the LAC suggests a proactive stance by the Indian Army, maintaining readiness for any potential conflict while also addressing the challenges posed by terrorism.

item.title: 75+ Happy Makar Sankranti Messages, Greetings, Wishes and Quotes for 2025 - The Times of India
item.description:
75+ Happy Makar Sankranti Messages, Greetings, Wishes and Quotes for 2025

Publication Date: Not provided Source: Not provided

This article provides over 75 messages, greetings, wishes, and quotes to celebrate Makar Sankranti in 2025, a popular festival in India marking the harvest season.

  • The significance of Makar Sankranti in various cultures.
  • Creative messages and quotes for sharing with loved ones.
  • Ways to celebrate the festival meaningfully.
"Makar Sankranti marks the transition of the sun into the zodiac sign of Capricorn."

The article serves as a comprehensive guide for those looking to connect and share joy during the Makar Sankranti festival.

item.title: Happy Lohri 2025: Wishes, images, status, quotes, messages, greetings, and photos - The Indian Express
item.description:
Happy Lohri 2025: Wishes, Images, Quotes, and Messages

Date: January 12, 2025

Source: Indian Express

Lohri is a popular Indian Punjabi folk festival celebrated in northern regions, marking the end of the winter solstice. It involves lighting a holy bonfire, symbolizing fertility and good fortune.

  • Lohri takes place one night before Makar Sankranti.
  • This year, Lohri will be celebrated on January 13, 2025.
  • Sharing images, greetings, and wishes is a key part of the celebration.
  • Wishes for happiness, health, and prosperity are a common theme.
"May your year be as bright as the bonfire, Happy Lohri 2025!"

Celebrate Lohri with joy and positivity, and share love and greetings with your family and friends.

item.title: Happy Magh Bihu 2025: Bhogali Bihu Wishes, Images, Messages, WhatsApp & Facebook Status - News18
item.description:
Happy Magh Bihu 2025: Celebrations and Best Wishes

Date: January 14, 2025
Source: News18

This article celebrates Magh Bihu, also known as Bhogali Bihu, a harvest festival observed in Assam that highlights community, abundance, and gratitude. The festivities for this year are set for January 15, with the Sankranti Moment occurring on January 14 at 09:03 AM.

  • Magh Bihu is a traditional Assamese harvest festival.
  • The festival brings people together through feasting and cultural practices.
  • Emphasis on the abundance of nature and community spirit.
  • Popular wishes include hopes for happiness, prosperity, and good health.
  • The importance of lighting Meji and enjoying traditional foods is highlighted.
“This Magh Bihu, I hope that you burn all the negativity of your life in the bonfire and welcome positive vibes.”

Magh Bihu is a time for celebration, reflection, and community bonding, marking the end of the harvest season with joy and gratitude.

item.title: Mahakumbh 2025: Over 1 crore take dip in Sangam on Day 1; first ‘Amrit Snan’ today as millions gather on Makar Sankranti - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Mahakumbh Mela 2025 kicked off with an attendance of over 1 crore devotees taking a holy dip at Sangam.

Date: January 14, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

A day after over 1 crore people took a dip in the sacred Sangam, a record number of devotees are expected to participate in the first ‘Amrit Snan’ today, January 14, during the Makar Sankranti festival in Prayagraj.

  • The first Amrit Snan of Mahakumbh is scheduled to begin at 5.30am, following a major dip on Monday.
  • Akhara participation is significant, with high-profile seers and Naga Sadhus attending.
  • Authorities have made extensive preparations for this 45-day religious event, including sanitation and security measures.
  • Over 10,000 police personnel have been deployed to ensure safety for the millions attending.
“Nine police teams will take all 13 akhadas to take holy dip, one after another - and it will continue till evening.” - DIG Vaibhav Krishna

The Mahakumbh 2025 is anticipated to draw enormous crowds and is a vital spiritual event marking this unique occasion.

item.title: Happy Pongal 2025: Wishes, Images, Status, And WhatsApp Greetings In English And Tamil - News18
item.description:
Happy Pongal 2025: Wishes, Images, Status, And WhatsApp Greetings In English And Tamil

Date: January 14, 2025 | Source: News18

Pongal, a vibrant harvest festival celebrated in January, honors the Sun God and emphasizes gratitude and abundance. This year, it falls on January 14, with joyful gatherings, traditional meals, and heartfelt greetings.

  • The festival spans four days, each celebrating different aspects of the harvest.
  • Wishes range from hopes for abundance in happiness and prosperity to heartfelt messages to loved ones.
  • Several beautiful images capture the spirit of the festivities, reflecting joy and celebration.
"May the harvest be plentiful, and may happiness fill your hearts this Pongal!"

Embrace the festive spirit and share joy with family and friends through meaningful greetings. Happy Pongal 2025!

item.title: Happy Pongal 2025: Wishes, images, status, quotes, messages, greetings, and photos to share - The Indian Express
item.description:
Happy Pongal 2025: Wishes, Images, Status, Quotes, Messages, Greetings Card, and Photos to share

Date: January 13, 2025 | Source: Indian Express

Pongal is a major Hindu festival celebrated in South India, particularly Tamil Nadu, recognizing the significance of agricultural prosperity and the Sun God.

  • Pongal will be celebrated from January 14 to January 17, 2025.
  • The festival is marked by gatherings, traditional decorations, and sharing of wishes and greetings.
  • Best wishes, quotes, and greeting cards for Pongal have been compiled for sharing with family and friends.
“Wishing you a Pongal that is filled with moments of joy, laughter, and togetherness.”

The festival fosters community and appreciation among families, celebrating joyful moments and shared agricultural heritage.
